item.title: Star Wars' Millennium Falcon VR coming to Google and Verizon
item.description:
Star Wars' Millennium Falcon VR coming to Google and Verizon

This week a combination of releases from Google, Lucasfilm and Disney, and Verizon have lead us to clues about the next big Star Wars virtual reality release. As StarWars.com suggests, the release date for this VR adventure will be December 2nd, 2015. There you'll find what they're describing as "first-of-its-kind serialized Google Cardboard Virtual Reality (VR) experience."

item.title: My Less Than Perfect Demo. Or, How I Came To Love The HTC Vive.
item.description: I was given the opportunity to take their HTC Vive for a spin. I was not impressed. At first.

item.title: Real Drugs, Virtual Reality: Meet the Psychonauts Tripping in the Rift
item.description:
Real Drugs, Virtual Reality: Meet the Psychonauts Tripping in the Rift

Imagine you're soaring through a colorful, 360-degree virtual world full of obstacles, making giant leaps, jumping walls and swinging through the air with a grappling hook, Spider-Man-style. Now imagine you can actually feel the g-forces and the wind on your face as you swing around, that the movement feels so real you forget you're in a game.

item.title: The Top 6 Gear VR Apps & Games for new owners
item.description:
The Top 6 Gear VR Apps & Games for new owners

Consumer VR is finally here with this week's release of the Samsung Gear VR. If you've never owned a Gear VR (there's two previous 'innovator editions' out since last year) but you've managed to get your hands on a pre-ordered headset and compatible phone, you're ready to plug into the world of virtual reality.

item.title: Hands on with GameFace Labs' Latest Prototype
item.description: If you've been plugged into the Virtual Reality scene for the past two years you probably heard of GameFace Labs, a company that over the past couple of years has been working on the first true wireless, self-contained "console on your face." Today I paid them a visit.

item.title: GameWorks VR Gives a Boost to Virtual Reality
item.description:
GameWorks VR Gives a Boost to Virtual Reality

Jason Paul, General Manager at NVIDIA, discusses the incredible advances GameWorks VR brings to virtual reality developers. Included in this is NVIDIA's Multi-Res Shading technology, which brings up to a 50% increase in virtual reality performance. Learn more: developer.nvidia.com/vr

item.title: Hands on with HoloLens: Watch out for robot bugs in the wall
item.description:
Hands on with HoloLens: Watch out for robot bugs in the wall

This week, Microsoft brought a demonstration of its newest augmented reality product, the HoloLens, to my home down of Phoenix, AZ. The Microsoft reps refer to this experience as "mixed reality," it uses a set of goggles that set a transparent screen on your face and add virtual "holograms" to the world in front of your face that you can interact with via voice and gesture.

item.title: Solfar's photoreal Mt Everest in VR is as close as you'll get to the real thing (Wired UK)
item.description:
Solfar's photoreal Mt Everest in VR is as close as you'll get to the real thing (Wired UK)

Staring down into the blackness of an icy crevasse in Everest VR, whilst balancing on a precarious ladder walkway buffeted by freezing wind, you realise just why people set out to climb the world's highest mountain. And also, why that those who do just might be a little insane.

item.title: Magic Leap Poaches HTC Vive's Executive Director of Global Marketing Ahead of Launch [Exclusive] - UploadVR
item.description:
Magic Leap Poaches HTC Vive's Executive Director of Global Marketing Ahead of Launch [Exclusive] - UploadVR

Eight months ago, Jeff Gattis stood on the stage in Barcelona at the Mobile World Conference and introduced us to the HTC Vive, a VR headset he was confident would "set the new industry standard" and would ship to consumers by the end of the year.

item.title: CES Does Not Understand VR
item.description:
CES Does Not Understand VR

There’s no graceful way to put this. Vuzix’s recently announced win of the CES 2016 Innovation Award in the Gaming and Virtual Reality is wholly undeserved.
